section.title: Operator
section.p: A person responsible for maintaining and administrating .

section.title: Dimension
section.p: A key/value pair that allows for a flexible and concise description of the data to be monitored, for example, region, availability zone, service tier, or resource ID. Each dimension describes a specific characteristic of the metrics to be monitored.
In , metrics are uniquely identified by a name and a set of dimensions. Dimensions can serve as a filter for the monitoring data.

section.title: Elasticsearch
section.p: An open source application that provides a highly scalable full-text search and analytics engine. uses Elasticsearch as the underlying technology for storing, searching, and analyzing large volumes of log data.

section.title: Grafana
section.p: An open source application for visualizing large-scale measurement data. integrates with Grafana for visualizing the monitoring data.

section.title: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)
section.p: The delivery of computer infrastructure (typically a platform virtualization environment) as a service.

section.title: Kibana
section.p: An open source analytics and visualization platform designed to work with Elasticsearch. integrates with Kibana for visualizing the log data.

section.title: Logstash
section.p: An open source application that provides a data collection engine with pipelining capabilities. integrates with Logstash for collecting, processing, and outputting logs.

section.title: Metrics
section.p: Self-describing data structures that allow for a flexible and concise description of the data to be monitored. Metrics values represent the actual monitoring data that is collected and presented in .

section.title: Monasca
section.p: An open source Monitoring as a Service solution that integrates with OpenStack. It forms the core of .

section.title: OpenStack Operator
section.p: A person responsible for maintaining and administrating OpenStack, the underlying platform technology of .

section.title: Platform as a Service (PaaS)
section.p: The delivery of a computing platform and solution stack as a service.

section.title: Software as a Service (SaaS)
section.p: A model of software deployment where a provider licenses an application to customers for use as a service on demand.

section.title: Tenant User
section.p: A person with limited access to cloud resources in OpenStack. A tenant user provides services to end users or hosts services for his own development activities.
